DOC.brief_summary: The objective of the trial is to investigate the Safety of LEO 43204 0.018%, 0.037% and 0.1% for actinic keratosis applied once daily for three consecutive days on face/chest, scalp and trunk/extremities, respectively.
DOC.brief_title: Safety of LEO 43204 for Actinic Keratosis Applied on Face/Chest, Scalp and Trunk/Extremities, Respectively
DOC.criteria: Subjects with 5 to 20 clinically typical, visible and, discrete, nonhyperkeratotic and nonhypertrophic AKs within a selected treatment area of sundamaged skin on either: The full face The full balding scalp A contiguous area of approximately 250 cm2 on trunk or extremities Location of the treatment area (full face, full balding scalp or chest) within 5 cm of an incompletely healed wound or within 5 cm of a suspected basal cell carcinoma (BCC) or SCC. Previously assigned treatment in this clinical trial or previously participated in a clinical trial in the LEO 43204 programme. Treatment with ingenol mebutate gel in the selected treatment area within the last 12 months Lesions in the treatment area that have: atypical clinical appearance (e.g. cutaneous horns) and/or, recalcitrant disease (e.g., did not respond to cryotherapy on two previous occasions).
